next_steps: Sign up for AWS Bedrock, Azure AI Foundry, and Google Vertex AI accounts and familiarize myself with their UIs for model evaluation and knowledge base setup.
Download and prepare the specified datasets (GSM8K, BBH, TruthfulQA subsets) and identify a suitable public corpus for the RAG knowledge base.
Draft the human evaluation rubric and instructions for Label Studio, focusing on correctness and faithfulness, and set up a small pilot batch for testing.
parsed.justification: This plan is great because it breaks down the initial setup into concrete, manageable steps that I can do in the next few days without needing Python. It also acknowledges my constraints and flags potential issues.

next_steps: Set up free-tier accounts on AWS Bedrock, Azure AI Foundry, and Google Vertex AI to access evaluation UIs
Download and prepare subset CSVs (200 items each) from GSM8K and TruthfulQA datasets for initial upload tests
Run a single prompt test on one platform using zero-shot template to verify the UI workflow and CSV export process
parsed.justification: The detailed experiment plan provides clear directional guidance but assumes familiarity with cloud platforms I don't have, making immediate next steps feel intimidating without basic onboarding; it flags important pitfalls but doesn't break down the initial setup barriers for a no-code beginner.

next_steps: Sign up for free developer accounts on AWS Bedrock, Azure AI Foundry, and Google Vertex AI to access their UIs for evaluations.
Download public dataset subsets like 200 items from GSM8K and TruthfulQA from their official GitHub repositories or sources.
Draft a simple protocol document outlining the zero-shot and few-shot prompts for Experiment 1, using the examples provided, and test one prompt manually on a free LLM playground like Hugging Face.
parsed.justification: As a student with no Python skills and limited time, this detailed no-code plan reduces my uncertainty by outlining clear UI-based steps and public resources I can access immediately, making me confident to start setups without coding. It fits my constraints perfectly but feels like a full project roadmap, so I'd focus on the Month 1 basics to act in 1-3 days.
